etymologies: late 19th century: from modern Latin Sauropoda (plural), from Greek sauros ‘lizard’ + pous, pod- ‘foot’

definitions: a very large quadrupedal herbivorous dinosaur with a long neck and tail, small head, and massive limbs.

notes.text: Infraorder Sauropoda, suborder Sauropodomorpha, order Saurischia; e.g. apatosaurus, brachiosaurus, and diplodocus

shortDefinitions: very large quadrupedal herbivorous dinosaur with long neck and tail
